label: Description
value: Full-length figure, facing right, of a young boy with a hoop.

label: Physical description
value: Scissor-cut black paper on white paper

label: Provenance
value: Arthur S. Vernay; 1914; Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Seated full-length figure, facing right, of a woman in a rocking chair, knitting.

label: Physical description
value: Scissor-cut black paper on white paper

label: Provenance
value: Arthur S. Vernay; 1914; Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Bowl has lancet leaves on lower half, on four animal feet. Domed cover with repousse laurel wreath and lemon finial.

label: Description
value: Shown in profile, galloping toward left. In the middle ground are represented on a small scale two sisters of Caligula brutalized by soldiers, a third killed by them; two officers kneeling in adoration; a statue of the emperor diguised as Jupiter adored by a couple; Caligula killed by soldiers. Rich moulded frame.

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1914; Acquired by Museum
Octavia Empress to Nero, in escutcheon

label: Description
value: Shown standing and against classical ruins, which a couple inspects in the right central distance. The escutcheon is composed of rocaille motifs and lattice.

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1914; Acquired by Museum
The Roman Emperor Vitellius (69), in escutcheon

label: Description
value: Shown in profile and slightly fro mthe back, galloping toward right. In the middle ground. The emperor eating in a tent; he has a woman and children killed; soldiers drag him and throw him into the Tiber. Fountains are included in the lateral framings.

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1914; Acquired by Museum
Flavia Domitilla, Wife of the Emperor Vespasian, in escutcheon

label: Description
value: Standing with half raised left arm. The Palazzo Venezia is shown in the right rear, an obelisk and a man in the left middle ground. The escutcheon is composed of rocaille motifs, plants, fruit bowls.

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1914; Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: The frame consis of pedestal and rocaille motifs, of vine and flowers. A phoenix is in the top center.

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1914; Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: The lion, battling with dogs, is attacked by a man on an unicorn with a bow and by another on foot with a trident. A third hunter blows a trumpet, at left. The clothes of the rider are decorated with stars. Two trees rise in the middle ground. Landscape with buildings displaying crescents.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving with etching, some green watercolor washes on paper

label: Description
value: A young man standing at left takes aim at a flock of birds at right. A boy holding dogs and a decoy stand beside him. A lady on horseback holds a falcon. She stands in the center under two trees. A man charges his gun, at right. Two groups of buildings in the distance.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving with etching with some green and blue watercolor washes on paper
The Return of the Prodigal Son

label: Description
value: Flanked by a girl and a stylishly clothed boy, the ragged and kneeling boy is embracedby his father, who wears a night robe.

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt and Eleanor Garnier Hewitt; 1914; Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Shoulder-length portrait of a young man in side view to left. His slightly wavy hair worn at ear length. He is wearing a jacket with a high collar and a white necktie.

label: Provenance
value: Francis H. Bigelow; 1914; Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Scenes from the song "Sing a Song of Sixpence" are depicted in a series of diamond shapes and triangles. Diamond shapes contain images of the King, Queen and Maid and lyrics to the song. Triangles show blackbirds and sixpence coins. Printed in shades of blue, brown and pink.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: roller printed on plain weave

label: Description
value: Fragment of chartreuse green silk with brocaded design of conventionalized flowers and foliage in purples, yellow, green, pink, red and white. Cut for a chair seat. Probably after a design by Pillement.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain weave patterned by floats of a supplementary warp and discontinuous supplementary wefts

label: Description
value: Oval panel in blue damask probably for a chair back with a design of an oval frame enclosing a floral group. Acanthus leaves and swags below frame.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: damassé (8-harness satin with 1/3 twill)

label: Description
value: Design for a ceiling over a square comparetment, representing a dome with large oculus and large lunettes on each side. Spandrels support crouching atlantid figures. Oculus and lunettes filled with figures in clouds.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink on paper, sepia and blue watercolor on paper

label: Description
value: Design for a forecourt with a colonnade along one side, and along another an arched opening into a hall surrounded by a colonnade. Niche with sculpture in forecourt, another in arched opening.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink with ink washes on laid paper

label: Description
value: Sketch in perspective of vestibule with coffered ceiling, beyond which is a large hall with vaulted ceiling.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, ink wash on paper

label: Description
value: High concave rim. The body decorated on the exterior with three bands of red containing radiated strokes, rabbits and reversed floral decoration joined by fillets. Interior centered with "eye" and red stripe at base of rim.

label: Description
value: Exterior decorated with two groups of three figures, each with central figure of woman holding vessel. Palmettes at handles. Interior centered with fretwork medallion containing woman facing seated man with staff.

label: Description
value: Globular body. Neck with flaring rim joined to strap handle attached to shoulder. Narrow band reserved in buff at the base.
Study for "Penn's Treaty with the Indians"

label: Description
value: Sketch of William Penn, with arms extended, surrounded by a group of Quakers, Indians, and merchants.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and ink on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Leverton Harris, London, England; 1915: acquired by the Museum

label: Description
value: Rectangular, with indented quadrant corners. Hinged cover with three circular pierced designs. Elaborately shaped hinge riveted on back; shaped plate with engraved scrolls and armorial bearings riveted to front face. Four cast feet in shell form, one at each corner. At either end, repoussé plate in form of mascaron, to which handle is attached.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1915: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Rectangular glass panel withshaped engraved borders on matt ground surrounding engraved subject of the youthful Virgin standing with the seated Saint Anne over the legend: "S. ANNA MAT. M. V."; within narrow scrolled frame of gilded wood.

label: Physical description
value: Engraved and silvered glass; carved, gessoed, and gilt wood

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Rectangular glass panel with shaped engraved borders on matt ground surrounding engraved subjects of Pope Julius II seated above a figure probably representing the evils overcome by his reforms; over the legend: "S. JULIUS PONT. MAX."; within narrow scrolled frame of gilded wood.

label: Physical description
value: Engraved and silvered glass, carved, gessoed, and gilt wood

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: A view of a rocky cove, with a pale-blue sky and pinkish-cream clouds reflected in the water.  Among foreground rocks, two small figures of fishermen dressed in caps and blue coats are visible, one holding a rod and the other a net.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and oil paint on mahogany wood panel

label: Provenance
value: Mr. Charles Savage Homer, Jr., New York, NY; 1915: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.

label: Notes
value: A view of a rocky cove, with a pale-blue sky and pinkish-cream clouds reflected in the water. Among foreground rocks, two small figures of fishermen dressed in caps and blue coats are visible, one holding a rod and the other a net.
Puck, Study for Manufactures and Liberal Arts Building, World's Columbian Exposition, Chicago, IL

label: Description
value: Figure of a boy with butterfly wings, a star on his head; left leg raised, foot held out behind; right arm held out to side, left arm crossed in front of body as hand holds rein. Concentric lines indicate curve of dome. Squared for copying.

label: Physical description
value: Charcoal and graphite on cream wove paper
The Electric Light, Study for Manufactures and Liberal Arts Building, World's Columbian Exposition, Chicago, IL

label: Description
value: Woman kneeling on right knee, drapery across thighs; head bent backward; left arm raised to hold framework for sphere, right arm extended across body.  Below, sketch of a cat. Squared for copying.

label: Physical description
value: Charcoal and graphite on cream wove paper
Figure Study, Possibly for Dome of Manufactures and Liberal Arts Building, World's Columbian Exposition, Chicago, IL

label: Description
value: Woman kneeling on right knee, drapery across thighs; torso bent backward; left arm raised, right arm extended across body; study of left hand, in which rests portion of a staff, at upper right.

label: Physical description
value: Charcoal and graphite on cream wove paper
The Morse Code, Study for "Electricity as Applied to Commerce," Manufactures and Liberal Arts Building, World's Columbian Exposition, Chicago, IL

label: Description
value: Draped figure of a woman seated on a stool, seen from below level of ground line, turned half-way toward left.  Across knees a folio, to left corner of which hand is held, while right hand rests on a telegraph key.  Center line drawn through figure.

label: Physical description
value: Black chalk and graphite on off-white paper
